etymologies: French, ‘marginal note’, from Latin appositum ‘placed, added’ or post illa ‘after those (words)’

definitions: a legal certification that makes a document from one country valid in another (provided that both are signatories to the 1961 Hague Convention Abolishing the Requirement for Legalization for Foreign Public Documents)

examples.text: she'll need the divorce decree or death certificate for her former spouse, translated into Spanish with an apostille

shortDefinitions: certificate making document from one country valid in another
